alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued May 08 at 6:12AM EDT until May 10 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Monday night, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tides at Point Lookout are at 7:21 AM and 8:09 PM. The next high tides at Piney Point are at 8:04 AM and 9:02 PM. The next high tides at Coltons Point are at 8:40 AM and 9:38 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. STRAITS POINT MD MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/08 AM 3.0 1.4 1.5 1.0 Minor 08/09 PM 3.2 1.6 1.8 1.0 Minor 09/08 AM 3.4 1.8 2.0 1.0 Minor 09/09 PM 3.6 2.0 2.2 1.0 Moderate 10/09 AM 3.8 2.2 2.4 1.0 Moderate 10/11 PM 3.8 2.2 2.3 1.0 Moderate
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
